title: When my opponent activates the effect of Ash Blossom & Joyous Spring from their hand, can I activate Orcust Crescendo in response?
question: When my opponent activates the effect of Ash Blossom & Joyous Spring from their hand, can I activate the『negate the activation, and if you do, banish that card』effect of Orcust Crescendo in response?
answer:
Yes, you can. If you do, the activation of Ash Blossom & Joyous Spring's effect will be negated. However, since Ash Blossom & Joyous Spring no longer exists in the location where its effect was activated, (the effect was activated by the Ash Blossom & Joyous Spring in your hand, which was then discarded as a cost,) Ash Blossom & Joyous Spring will not be banished by Orcust Crescendo.

The same applies to the following effects, if they are used in response to the activation of the effect of Ash Blossom & Joyous Spring: Myutant Ultimus, Shooting Majestic Star Dragon, Nekroz of Areadbhair, Dragunity Knight - Areadbhair, Cynet Conflict, Tri-Gate Wizard, Invoked Mechaba, Gameciel, the Sea Turtle Kaiju, Infernoid Devyaty, and Debunk.
llm_answer: No, you cannot activate Orcust Crescendo in response to Ash Blossom & Joyous Spring. Ash Blossom & Joyous Spring is a hand trap effect that cannot be chained to by cards that negate activations.
